body_html:
@danlijar you should change the following line on your blog:

max_length = int(output.get_shape()[1])

to:

max_length = tf.shape(output)[1]

since in general max_length can vary from run to run.

On Thu, Jul 28, 2016 at 8:04 AM, s4sarath notifications@github.com wrote:

@danijar https://github.com/danijar . Yeah I am following your blog for
variable length sequence classification.
@ebrevdo https://github.com/ebrevdo - Thanks .

—

body:
@danlijar you should change the following line on your blog:

max_length = int(output.get_shape()[1])

to:

max_length = tf.shape(output)[1]

since in general max_length can vary from run to run.

On Thu, Jul 28, 2016 at 8:04 AM, s4sarath notifications@github.com wrote:

> @danijar https://github.com/danijar . Yeah I am following your blog for
> variable length sequence classification.
> @ebrevdo https://github.com/ebrevdo - Thanks .
>
